Enable this mode to compare the calculat: Enable this mode to compare the calculated hash value with a manually entered hash.
Determines how large chunks of files wil: Determines how large chunks of files will be read. Larger chunks can increase speed but also increase memory usage.
Determines the output size of SHAKE algo: Determines the output size of SHAKE algorithms. It is recommended to use at least 32 for 128-bit security and 64 for 256-bit.
These algorithms are considered weak and: These algorithms are considered weak and should not be used in security applications. Use them only to verify legacy hashes.
Disables security policies such as acces: Disables security policies such as access to files on external drives and file size limits.
Stops logging application crashes and er: Stops logging application crashes and error messages to the app.log file.
The calculated hash will appear here.
This file is on an external storage devi: This file is on an external storage device. Ejecting the drive during the process may cause data corruption. Do you approve?
The selected file has unsuitable permiss: The selected file has unsuitable permissions or location.
Symbolic links are not supported for sec: Symbolic links are not supported for security reasons.
File could not be read. Driver might be: File could not be read. Driver might be ejected or file corrupt.
The file size exceeds the limit.
An error occurred while checking the ext: An error occurred while checking the external drive.
EasyHash is a completely open source Has: EasyHash is a completely open source Hash measurement application.
EasyHash source code is available on our: EasyHash source code is available on our official GitHub page.
We do not have any donations or PayPal p: We do not have any donations or PayPal page.
EasyHash DOES NOT collect any informatio: EasyHash DOES NOT collect any information or data, but an "app.log" file is located in the user's local AppData folder, which is used to record application crashes and other simple things and is NOT SHARED or COLLECTED with anyone. If you do not want the "app.log" file to collect crash data, you can turn it off in the application settings.
Please drag a file, not a folder.
